org.bladerunnerjs.plugin

Interface Plugin

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    AssetLocationPlugin, AssetPlugin, CommandPlugin, ContentPlugin, MinifierPlugin, ModelObserverPlugin, OrderedPlugin, RequirePlugin, TagHandlerPlugin
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAssetLocationPlugin, AbstractAssetPlugin, AbstractCommandPlugin, AbstractContentPlugin, AbstractMinifierPlugin, AbstractModelObserverPlugin, AbstractPlugin, AbstractRequirePlugin, AbstractTagHandlerPlugin, AliasingContentPlugin, AliasRequirePlugin, AppDeploymentObserverPlugin, ApplicationDepsCommand, AppMetadataContentPlugin, ArgsParsingCommandPlugin, BaseTagHandlePlugin, BRJSConformantAssetLocationPlugin, BRJSConformantTestPackAssetLocationPlugin, BuildAppCommand, BundleDepsCommand, ClosureMinifierPlugin, CommonJsAssetPlugin, CommonJsContentPlugin, CompositeJsContentPlugin, CompositeJsTagHandlerPlugin, ConcatentatingMinifierPlugin, CopyBladesetCommand, CopyThemeCommand, CreateAppCommand, CreateAspectCommand, CreateBladeCommand, CreateBladesetCommand, CreateLibraryCommand, CssAssetPlugin, CssContentPlugin, CssResourceAssetPlugin, CssResourceContentPlugin, CssTagHandlerPlugin, DefaultRequirePlugin, DepInsightCommand, ExportApplicationCommand, HelpCommand, HTMLAssetPlugin, HTMLContentPlugin, I18nAssetPlugin, I18nContentPlugin, I18nTagHandlerPlugin, ImportAppCommand, InlineTagHandlerPlugin, J2eeifyCommandPlugin, JsDocCommand, JsDocObserver, NamespacedJsAssetPlugin, NamespacedJsContentPlugin, ServeCommand, ServiceRequirePlugin, ThirdpartyAssetLocationPlugin, ThirdpartyAssetPlugin, ThirdpartyContentPlugin, UnbundledResourcesContentPlugin, VersionCommand, VirtualProxyAssetLocationPlugin, VirtualProxyAssetPlugin, VirtualProxyCommandPlugin, VirtualProxyContentPlugin, VirtualProxyMinifierPlugin, VirtualProxyModelObserverPlugin, VirtualProxyPlugin, VirtualProxyRequirePlugin, VirtualProxyTagHandlerPlugin, WorkbenchDepsCommand, XMLAssetPlugin, XMLContentPlugin

    public interface Plugin
    Plugin is the base interface for all plug-ins within BladeRunnerJS. Plug-ins are discovered automatically by BladeRunnerJS (using the SPI Mechanism introduced in Java 6), and are constructed using a zero-arg constructor. The setBRJS() method is used in lieu of a parameterized constructor, and is invoked before any non-identifier methods (see below).

    Because plug-ins form part of the model, yet use the model to initialize themselves, an untenable circular dependency exists. To overcome this problem, each concrete plug-in instance is wrapped inside a virtual proxy that delays plug-in initialization until somebody attempts to actually use the plug-in. Since code interested in interacting with a subset of the plug-ins will often need to query all of them to locate the ones it needs, certain identifier-methods are proxied through before the object's setBRJS() method has been invoked, which plug-in authors must be aware of.

    Another consequence of wrapping all plug-ins in a virtual proxy is that the instanceof operator and the Object.getClass() method do not work as expected. The instanceOf() and getPluginClass() methods are provided to overcome these deficiencies.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Invoked during the invocation of BRJS.close(), offering plug-ins a chance to release any resources they may be holding on to.
      java.lang.Class<?> getPluginClass()
      An alternative to Java's Object.getClass() method that is needed because BladeRunnerJS wraps plug-ins within virtual proxy wrappers, causing the native Object.getClass() method to become ineffective.
      boolean instanceOf(java.lang.Class<? extends Plugin> otherPluginCLass)
      An alternative to Java's instanceof operator that is needed because BladeRunnerJS wraps plug-ins within virtual proxy wrappers, causing the native instanceof operator to become ineffective.
      void setBRJS(BRJS brjs)
      Invoked after construction, and before any non-identifier methods have been invoked, so plug-ins have a reference to the BladeRunnerJS model.

    • Method Detail

      • setBRJS

        void setBRJS(BRJS brjs)
        Invoked after construction, and before any non-identifier methods have been invoked, so plug-ins have a reference to the BladeRunnerJS model.
        Parameters:
        brjs - The reference to the BladeRunnerJS model.

      • close

        void close()
        Invoked during the invocation of BRJS.close(), offering plug-ins a chance to release any resources they may be holding on to.

      • instanceOf

        boolean instanceOf(java.lang.Class<? extends Plugin> otherPluginCLass)
        An alternative to Java's instanceof operator that is needed because BladeRunnerJS wraps plug-ins within virtual proxy wrappers, causing the native instanceof operator to become ineffective.

        Plug-ins are not expected to implement this method themselves, and should instead extend one of the AbstractPlugin sub-classes (e.g. AbstractCommandPlugin).

        Parameters:
        otherPluginCLass - The class which this object may, or may not be, an instance of.
        Returns:
        true, if this object is an instance of the given class, and false otherwise.

      • getPluginClass

        java.lang.Class<?> getPluginClass()
        An alternative to Java's Object.getClass() method that is needed because BladeRunnerJS wraps plug-ins within virtual proxy wrappers, causing the native Object.getClass() method to become ineffective.

        Plug-ins are not expected to implement this method themselves, and should instead extend one of the AbstractPlugin sub-classes (e.g. AbstractCommandPlugin).

        Returns:
        A reference to the class of the underlying plug-in.
